name: jirilebl_ca_ca_758
nl_statement: Prove the \emph{polarization identity} $4 z\bar{w} = {\lvert z+w\rvert}^2-{\lvert z-w\rvert}^2 +i \bigl( {\lvert z+iw\rvert}^2 - {\lvert z-iw\rvert}^2 \bigr)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_997
nl_statement: Prove that if the $2 \times 2$ matrix $M$ represents a complex number $a+ib$, then $M$ has two eigenvalues: $a \pm i b$ with the corresponding eigenvectors $\left[ \begin{smallmatrix} 1 \\ \mp i \end{smallmatrix} \right]$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1006
nl_statement: Prove that every real-linear operator on $\mathbb{C}$ (that is, every $2 \times 2$ real matrix $M$) can be represented by two complex numbers $\xi$ and $\zeta$, and the formula $z \mapsto \xi z + \zeta \bar{z}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1158
nl_statement: Let $z,w$ be two nonzero complex numbers and let $\ell_z$ and $\ell_w$ be the lines through the origin and $z$ and $w$ respectively. Write $\theta$ for the angle between $\ell_z$ and $\ell_w$. Then prove that $\Re z\bar{w} = \lvert z\rvert \lvert w\rvert \cos \theta$. Note that $\Re z\bar{w}$ is the standard real dot product in $\mathbb{R}^2$, and so you are asked to prove the formula for the dot product from calculus.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1326
nl_statement:
Use $e^{z+w} = e^z e^w$ and $e^0 = 1 
ot= 0$ to show that $e^z 
ot=0$ for all $z \in \mathbb{C}$. In other words, show that if a function $f$ satisfies $f(z+w)=f(z)f(w)$ and $f(0) = 1$, then $f(z) 
ot= 0$ for all $z$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1426
nl_statement: Suppose $L \in \mathbb{C}$ and $z_0 \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lim_{z\to z_0} f(z) = L$ in the sense of the Riemann sphere if and only if $\lim_{z \to z_0} f(z) = L$ in the usual sense (the euclidean metric on $\mathbb{C}$).

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1430
nl_statement: Suppose $L \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lim_{z\to \infty} f(z) = L$ in the sense of the Riemann sphere if and only if for every $\epsilon > 0$ there exists an $M$ such that $\lvert f(z)-L\rvert < \epsilon$ whenever $\lvert z\rvert > M$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1436
nl_statement: Suppose $z_0 \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lim_{z\to z_0} f(z) = \infty$ in the sense of the Riemann sphere if and only if for every $M > 0$ there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that $\lvert f(z)\rvert > M$ whenever $\lvert z-z_0\rvert < \delta$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1442
nl_statement: Suppose $L \in \mathbb{C}_\infty$. Show that $\lim\limits_{z\to\infty} f(z) = L$ if and only if $\lim\limits_{z \to 0} f(\frac{1}{z}) = L$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1447
nl_statement: Suppose $z_0 \in \mathbb{C}_\infty$. Show that $\lim\limits_{z\to z_0} f(z) = \infty$ if and only if $\lim\limits_{z \to z_0} \frac{1}{f(z)} = 0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1550
nl_statement: Prove that an LFT is a bijective mapping of the Riemann sphere to itself.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1618
nl_statement: Prove that if we include straight lines in the set of circles, then \emph{an LFT maps circles to circles}.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1623
nl_statement: Prove that given any circle or a straight line, there exists an LFT that maps this set to the real line.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1967
nl_statement: Directly from the definition of the complex derivative, show that a function is holomorphic at $z_0$ if and only if the Cauchy–Riemann equations are satisfied at $z_0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2018
nl_statement: If $f \colon \mathbb{C} \to \mathbb{C}$ is complex differentiable at a point, then $f$ is continuous at that point.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2132
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{C} \to \mathbb{C}$ is differentiable at $z_0$ in the real sense, i.e., as a function of two real variables, and that the partial derivatives are continuous near $z_0$. Show that the Cauchy–Riemann equations at $z_0$ hold if and only if $f$ is complex differentiable at $z_0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2215
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is complex differentiable at every $z \in U$. Show that $f$ is holomorphic.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2353
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{C} \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic. Show that $f$ is conformal at a point $z_0$ if and only if $f'(z_0) \not= 0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2441
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $f'(z) \not= 0$ for every $z \in U$. Show that $f$ is locally injective on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2577
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be an open set and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be a holomorphic function. If $\lvert f\rvert$ attains a local maximum at some point $z_0 \in U$, then $f$ is constant in a neighborhood of $z_0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2649
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be a domain and $f,g \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic. If $S \subset U$ has an accumulation point in $U$ and $f(z) = g(z)$ for all $z \in S$, then $f(z) = g(z)$ for all $z \in U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2718
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be a domain and suppose that a holomorphic function $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is not constant. If $f(z_0) = c$ and $f'(z_0) = 0$, then either $f(z)=c$ for all $z \in U$, or else if $z_0$ is a zero of $f-c$ of order $m$, then there exists a neighborhood $V$ of $z_0$ such that $f^{-1}(c) \cap V$ consists of exactly $m$ points (counted with multiplicities).

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_3078
nl_statement: If $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is a holomorphic function on a domain $U \subset \mathbb{C}$, then $f$ is analytic. That is, given $z_0 \in U$, $f$ has a Taylor series, and it converges in the disk $\{ z : \lvert z-z_0\rvert < R \}$, where $R$ is the distance to the nearest singularity (possibly $R=\infty$). Furthermore, the sum of the series is $f$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_3401
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $K \subset U$ is compact, and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic. Then there exists an $M>0$ such that $\lvert f(z)\rvert \leq M$ for all $z \in K$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_5157
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, and $\psi \colon U \times [0,1] \to \mathbb{C}$ is a continuous function such that for each fixed $t \in [0,1]$, the function $z \mapsto \psi(z,t)$ is holomorphic. Then $h(z) = \int_0^1 \psi(z,t) \, dt$ is a holomorphic function on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_5485
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{D} \to \mathbb{D}$ is holomorphic and $f(0) = 0$, then $\lvert f'(0)\rvert \leq 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_6983
nl_statement: Suppose $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{C} \setminus \{ 0 \}$ is a piecewise smooth curve and $\theta \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous such that $e^{i\theta(t)} = \gamma(t) / \lvert \gamma(t)\rvert$ for all $t \in [a,b]$, that is, $\theta(t)$ is an argument of $\gamma(t)$. Show that there exists a continuous function $\widetilde{\theta} \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ such that $e^{i\widetilde{\theta}(t)} = \gamma(t) / \lvert \gamma(t)\rvert$ for all $t \in [a,b]$ and $\widetilde{\theta}(a) = \theta(a)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_7079
nl_statement: Suppose $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{C} \setminus \{ 0 \}$ is a piecewise smooth curve and $\theta \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous such that $e^{i\theta(t)} = \gamma(t) / \lvert \gamma(t)\rvert$ for all $t \in [a,b]$. Suppose $\gamma$ is simple and does not go through the origin. Show that there exists a $\widetilde{\theta} \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ such that $e^{i\widetilde{\theta}(t)} = \gamma(t) / \lvert \gamma(t)\rvert$ for all $t \in [a,b]$ and $\widetilde{\theta}(a) = \theta(a)$, and in addition $\widetilde{\theta}(b) = \widetilde{\theta}(a) + 2\pi$ if and only if the origin is inside the region bounded by $\gamma$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_7485
nl_statement: Let $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{C}$ be an injective continuous curve such that $\gamma(a) = \gamma(b)$, and suppose $\gamma$ is piecewise smooth. Show that $\mathbb{C} \setminus \gamma$ has exactly two components.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_9443
nl_statement: If $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and injective, then $f'(z) \not= 0$ for every $z \in U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_9467
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to U$ is piecewise smooth, $g \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, $F \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is continuous, and $F(z) = \int_0^z g(w) \, dw$. Then $\int_\gamma F(z) \, dz = \int_a^b \left( \int_0^{\gamma(t)} g(w) \, dw \right) \gamma'(t) \, dt .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_9865
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open. Then there exists a sequence $K_n$ of compact subsets of $U$ such that $K_n \subset K_{n+1}^\circ$, $U = \bigcup_{n=1}^\infty K_n^\circ$, and for each $n$ there exists a finite collection of closed disks $D_{kn}$ with $K_n \subset \bigcup_k D_{kn} \subset K_{n+1}^\circ$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_10464
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and suppose that $K \subset U$ is compact and has connected complement, and suppose $f \colon U \setminus K \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and $\int_\gamma f(z) \, dz = 0$ for every piecewise smooth closed curve $\gamma$ in $U \setminus K$. Then there exists a holomorphic $F \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ such that $F'(z) = f(z)$ for all $z \in U \setminus K$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_12556
nl_statement: Suppose $f$ is a holomorphic function on a neighborhood of the closed disk $\overline{D}(0,1)$ and suppose $f(0) \not= 0$. Then there exists a constant $C$ such that for all $m \in \mathbb{N}$ and $\lvert z\rvert \leq 1$, $\left\lvert 1 - \sum_{k=0}^m \frac{f^{(k)}(0)}{k! f(0)} \, z^k \right\rvert \leq C \lvert z\rvert^{m+1} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_12577
nl_statement: $\lvert 1-E_m(z)\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert^{m+1}$ for all $m = 0,1,2,\ldots$ and all $z \in \mathbb{D}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_13194
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open, $K \subset U$ compact, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ holomorphic, and $g \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be continuous and holomorphic on $U \setminus K$. Suppose $\int_\gamma g(z) \, dz = 0$ for every piecewise smooth closed $\gamma$ in $U \setminus K$. Then there exists a function $F \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ such that $F$ is holomorphic on $U \setminus K$, $F'(z) = g(z)$ on $U \setminus K$, and $\int_\gamma F(z) \, dz = \int_a^b \left( \int_0^{\gamma(t)} g(w) \, dw \right) \gamma'(t) \, dt$ for every piecewise smooth curve $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_13326
nl_statement: Suppose $K \subset \mathbb{C}$ is compact, $g \colon \mathbb{C} \setminus K \to \mathbb{C}$ is continuous and holomorphic on $\mathbb{C} \setminus K$, and $\int_\gamma g(z) \, dz = 0$ for every piecewise smooth closed curve $\gamma$ in $\mathbb{C} \setminus K$. Then there exists a holomorphic function $F \colon \mathbb{C} \to \mathbb{C}$ such that $F'(z) = g(z)$ on $\mathbb{C} \setminus K$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_13473
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open. Then there exists a sequence $K_n$ of compact subsets of $U$ such that $K_n \subset K_{n+1}^\circ$, $U = \bigcup_{n=1}^\infty K_n^\circ$, and for each $n$ there exists a finite collection of closed disks $D_{kn}$ with $K_n \subset \bigcup_k D_{kn} \subset K_{n+1}^\circ$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14661
nl_statement: If $x =(x_1,x_2,\ldots,x_n) \in \mathbb{R}^n$, $y =(y_1,y_2,\ldots,y_n) \in \mathbb{R}^n$, and $[x,y] = (x_1y_1+x_2y_2+\cdots+x_ny_n)$, then $\lvert [x,y]\rvert^2 \leq [x,x] \, [y,y] .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15845
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a metric space and $K \subset X$. Suppose $K \subset \bigcup_{j=1}^m B(x_j,r_j),$ where every $B(x_j,r_j)$ is an open ball. Then there is a $\delta > 0$ such that if $0 < r_j < \delta$ for $j=1,2,\ldots,m$, then $\operatorname{vol}(K) \leq \sum_{j=1}^m \operatorname{vol}\bigl( \overline{B}(x_j,r_j) \bigr) .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_16245
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces and suppose $T \colon X \to Y$ is continuous and $K \subset X$ is compact. Show that $T(K)$ is compact.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_16328
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces. Show that a set $U \subset X$ is open if and only if for every $x \in U$ there exists an $\epsilon > 0$ such that $B(x,\epsilon) \subset U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_16598
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces, $S \subset X$, $p \in X$ and suppose $T \colon X \to Y$ is continuous at $p$. If there exists a sequence $x_n \in S$ such that $x_n \to p$, then $\lim_{n\to\infty} T(x_n) = T(p) .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_17562
nl_statement: If $\varphi \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}^n$ is differentiable on $(a,b)$ and continuous on $[a,b]$, then $\operatorname{length}(\varphi) \leq \int_a^b \lVert \varphi'(t) \rVert \, dt .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_17658
nl_statement: Let $\epsilon > 0$, let $p(z)$ be a nonconstant complex polynomial, or more generally a nonconstant power series converging in $\{ z \in \mathbb{C} : \lvert z-z_0\rvert < \epsilon \}$, and suppose $p(z_0) \not= 0$. Then there exists a $w \in \{ z \in \mathbb{C} : \lvert z-z_0\rvert < \epsilon \}$ such that $\lvert p(w)\rvert < \lvert p(z_0)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_17758
nl_statement: Let $p(z)$ be a nonconstant complex polynomial. Then for an $M > 0$, there exists an $R > 0$ such that $\lvert p(z)\rvert \geq M$ whenever $\lvert z\rvert \geq R$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_17814
nl_statement: Prove that for $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$, we have $\lvert zw\rvert = \lvert z\rvert \, \lvert w\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18064
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Prove that $\lvert z^n\rvert = \lvert z\rvert^n$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18104
nl_statement: Let $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Prove that $\lvert (z+w)^n\rvert \leq 2^{n-1} (\lvert z\rvert^n + \lvert w\rvert^n)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18142
nl_statement: Let $a,b \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert a+b\rvert^2 = \lvert a\rvert^2 + \lvert b\rvert^2 + 2 \Re(a \bar{b})$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18174
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert$ and $\lvert \Im z\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18204
nl_statement: If $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $\lvert z\rvert = 1$, then show that $\bar{z} = 1/z$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18234
nl_statement: If $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $\lvert z\rvert = 1$, then prove that $\Re z \leq \lvert z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18270
nl_statement: Let $a,b \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \Re a - \Re b\rvert \leq \lvert a-b\rvert$ and $\lvert \Im a - \Im b\rvert \leq \lvert a-b\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18304
nl_statement: If $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$, then show that $\lvert z+w\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert + \lvert w\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18335
nl_statement: If $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$, then show that $\lvert z-w\rvert \geq \bigl\lvert \lvert z\rvert - \lvert w\rvert \bigr\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18368
nl_statement: If $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$, then show that $\lvert z-w\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert + \lvert w\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18400
nl_statement: Let $a,z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert \leq \lvert a\rvert/2$. Show that $\lvert a+z\rvert \geq \lvert a\rvert/2$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18433
nl_statement: Let $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Show that $\lvert z^n-w^n\rvert \leq n \max(\lvert z\rvert^{n-1},\lvert w\rvert^{n-1}) \, \lvert z-w\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18475
nl_statement: Let $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$ with $w \not= 0$. Prove that $\left\lvert \frac{z}{w} \right\rvert = \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{\lvert w\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18507
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Prove that $\lvert (1+z)^n - 1\rvert \leq n \lvert z\rvert (1+\lvert z\rvert)^{n-1}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18541
nl_statement: Prove that if $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$ and $\lvert z\rvert = \lvert w\rvert$, then $\lvert z+w\rvert = \lvert z-w\rvert$ if and only if $z \bar{w}$ is purely imaginary.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18579
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert e^z\rvert = e^{\Re z}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18609
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \leq \cosh(\Im z)$ and $\lvert \cos z\rvert \leq \cosh(\Im z)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18644
nl_statement: If $z \in \mathbb{C}$, then prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \cosh(\Re z)$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq \lvert \sinh z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18681
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Show that $\frac{1}{\lvert 1-z\rvert} \leq \frac{1}{1-\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18712
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \geq \lvert \Im z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18742
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cos z - 1\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} \lvert z\rvert^2 e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18773
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tanh z\rvert \leq \tanh \lvert \Re z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18806
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \cosh z - 1\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} \lvert z\rvert^2 e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18838
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \Re z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18866
nl_statement: Prove that if $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $\lvert z\rvert < 1$, then $\lvert \log(1-z)\rvert \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18898
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Show that $\lvert \arctan z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4} \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18935
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18967
nl_statement: Let $x \in \mathbb{R}$. Show that $\sin x \leq x$ for $x \geq 0$ and $\cos x \geq 1 - \frac{x^2}{2}$ for all $x$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19001
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cos z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19031
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tan z\rvert \geq \lvert \Im z\rvert$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19065
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cos z\rvert \geq \lvert \cos (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19095
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \tan z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2 \lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19128
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cot z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2 \lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19161
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \csc z\rvert \geq \lvert \csc (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19192
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sec z\rvert \geq \lvert \sec (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19223
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \geq \lvert \sin (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19254
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cos z\rvert \geq \lvert \cos (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19284
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \sinh (\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq \lvert \cosh (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19318
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tanh z\rvert \geq \lvert \tanh (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19350
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \coth z\rvert \geq \lvert \coth (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19382
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19411
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \lvert \cosh z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19441
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19472
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \Re z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19502
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Show that $\sum_{n=1}^\infty \lvert z\rvert^{n} = \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19530
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cos z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19562
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that for all $n \in \mathbb{N}$, $\left\lvert \sum_{k=0}^n \frac{z^k}{k!} - e^z \right\rvert \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert^{n+1}}{(n+1)!} e^{\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19596
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \tan z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2\lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19628
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$. Show that $\lvert \cot z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19661
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sec z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \csc z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19692
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cos z\rvert \geq \lvert \cos(\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \sin z\rvert \geq \lvert \sin(\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19722
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tanh z\rvert \geq \lvert \tanh(\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \coth z\rvert \geq \lvert \coth(\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19753
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq \lvert \sinh z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19783
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \Re z\rvert$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19814
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Show that $\lvert \log(1-z)\rvert \leq \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{\lvert z\rvert^n}{n} \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19849
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \arctan z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4} \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert z\rvert < 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19884
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19916
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\sin x \leq x$ for $x \geq 0$ and $\cos x \geq 1 - \frac{x^2}{2}$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19947
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cos z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19978
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that for all $n \in \mathbb{N}$, $\left\lvert \sum_{k=0}^n \frac{z^k}{k!} - e^z \right\rvert \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert^{n+1}}{(n+1)!} e^{\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20012
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tan z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2\lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20042
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cot z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2\lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20074
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sec z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \csc z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20104
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cos z\rvert \geq \lvert \cos(\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \sin z\rvert \geq \lvert \sin(\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20136
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tanh z\rvert \geq \lvert \tanh(\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \coth z\rvert \geq \lvert \coth(\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20165
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq \lvert \sinh z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20195
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \Re z\rvert$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20226
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Show that $\lvert \log(1-z)\rvert \leq \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{\lvert z\rvert^n}{n} \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20261
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \arctan z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4} \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert z\rvert < 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20296
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20328
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\sin x \leq x$ for $x \geq 0$ and $\cos x \geq 1 - \frac{x^2}{2}$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20359
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cos z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20390
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that for all $n \in \mathbb{N}$, $\left\lvert \sum_{k=0}^n \frac{z^k}{k!} - e^z \right\rvert \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert^{n+1}}{(n+1)!} e^{\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_886
nl_statement: Prove the \emph{polarization identity} $4 z\bar{w} = {\lvert z+w\rvert}^2-{\lvert z-w\rvert}^2 +i \bigl( {\lvert z+iw\rvert}^2 - {\lvert z-iw\rvert}^2 \bigr)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_923
nl_statement: Prove that if the $2 \times 2$ matrix $M$ represents a complex number $a+ib$, then $M$ has two eigenvalues: $a \pm i b$ with the corresponding eigenvectors $\left[ \begin{smallmatrix} 1 \\ \mp i \end{smallmatrix} \right]$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_930
nl_statement: Prove that every real-linear operator on $\mathbb{C}$ (that is, every $2 \times 2$ real matrix $M$) can be represented by two complex numbers $\xi$ and $\zeta$, and the formula $z \mapsto \xi z + \zeta \bar{z}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1143
nl_statement: Suppose a $2 \times 2$ real matrix $M$ represents multiplication by $\xi \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\det M = \lvert \xi\rvert^2$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1146
nl_statement: Suppose a $2 \times 2$ real matrix $M$ is represented by $z \mapsto \xi z + \zeta \bar{z}$ . Show that $\det M = \lvert \xi\rvert^2 - \lvert \zeta\rvert^2$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1230
nl_statement: Let $z,w$ be two nonzero complex numbers and let $\ell_z$ and $\ell_w$ be the lines through the origin and $z$ and $w$ respectively. Write $\theta$ for the angle between $\ell_z$ and $\ell_w$. Then prove that $\Re z\bar{w} = \lvert z\rvert \lvert w\rvert \cos \theta$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1314
nl_statement:
Use $e^{z+w} = e^z e^w$ and $e^0 = 1 
ot= 0$ to show that $e^z 
ot=0$ for all $z \in \mathbb{C}$. In other words, show that if a function $f$ satisfies $f(z+w)=f(z)f(w)$ and $f(0) = 1$, then $f(z) 
ot= 0$ for all $z$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1462
nl_statement: Suppose $L \in \mathbb{C}$ and $z_0 \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lim_{z\to z_0} f(z) = L$ in the sense of the Riemann sphere if and only if $\lim_{z\to z_0} f(z) = L$ in the usual sense (the euclidean metric on $\mathbb{C}$).

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1469
nl_statement: Suppose $L \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lim_{z\to \infty} f(z) = L$ in the sense of the Riemann sphere if and only if for every $\epsilon > 0$ there exists an $M$ such that $\lvert f(z)-L\rvert < \epsilon$ whenever $\lvert z\rvert > M$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1476
nl_statement: Suppose $z_0 \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lim_{z\to z_0} f(z) = \infty$ in the sense of the Riemann sphere if and only if for every $M > 0$ there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that $\lvert f(z)\rvert > M$ whenever $\lvert z-z_0\rvert < \delta$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1483
nl_statement: Suppose $L \in \mathbb{C}_\infty$. Show that $\lim\limits_{z\to\infty} f(z) = L$ if and only if $\lim\limits_{z \to 0} f(\frac{1}{z}) = L$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1490
nl_statement: Suppose $z_0 \in \mathbb{C}_\infty$. Show that $\lim\limits_{z\to z_0} f(z) = \infty$ if and only if $\lim\limits_{z \to z_0} \frac{1}{f(z)} = 0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1578
nl_statement: Prove that a linear fractional transformation is a bijective mapping of the Riemann sphere to itself.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1651
nl_statement: Prove that if we include straight lines in the set of circles, then an LFT maps circles to circles.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1656
nl_statement: Prove that given any circle or a straight line, there exists an LFT that maps this set to the real line.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_1983
nl_statement: Directly from the definition of the complex derivative, show that a function is holomorphic at $z_0$ if and only if the Cauchy--Riemann equations are satisfied at $z_0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2032
nl_statement: If $f \colon \mathbb{C} \to \mathbb{C}$ is complex differentiable at a point, then $f$ is continuous at that point.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2141
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{C} \to \mathbb{C}$ is differentiable at $z_0$ in the real sense, i.e., as a function of two real variables, and that the partial derivatives are continuous near $z_0$. Show that the Cauchy--Riemann equations at $z_0$ hold if and only if $f$ is complex differentiable at $z_0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2227
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is complex differentiable at every $z \in U$. Show that $f$ is holomorphic.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2342
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{C} \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic. Show that $f$ is conformal at a point $z_0$ if and only if $f'(z_0) \not= 0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2427
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $f'(z) \not= 0$ for every $z \in U$. Show that $f$ is locally injective on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2590
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be an open set and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be a holomorphic function. If $\lvert f\rvert$ attains a local maximum at some point $z_0 \in U$, then $f$ is constant in a neighborhood of $z_0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2664
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be a domain and $f,g \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic. If $S \subset U$ has an accumulation point in $U$ and $f(z) = g(z)$ for all $z \in S$, then $f(z) = g(z)$ for all $z \in U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2735
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be a domain and suppose that a holomorphic function $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is not constant. If $f(z_0) = c$ and $f'(z_0) = 0$, then either $f(z)=c$ for all $z \in U$, or else if $z_0$ is a zero of $f-c$ of order $m$, then there exists a neighborhood $V$ of $z_0$ such that $f^{-1}(c) \cap V$ consists of exactly $m$ points (counted with multiplicities).

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_3157
nl_statement: If $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is a holomorphic function on a domain $U \subset \mathbb{C}$, then $f$ is analytic. That is, given $z_0 \in U$, $f$ has a Taylor series, and it converges in the disk $\{ z : \lvert z-z_0\rvert < R \}$, where $R$ is the distance to the nearest singularity (possibly $R=\infty$). Furthermore, the sum of the series is $f$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_3513
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $K \subset U$ is compact, and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic. Then there exists an $M>0$ such that $\lvert f(z)\rvert \leq M$ for all $z \in K$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_5188
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, and $\psi \colon U \times [0,1] \to \mathbb{C}$ is a continuous function such that for each fixed $t \in [0,1]$, the function $z \mapsto \psi(z,t)$ is holomorphic. Then $h(z) = \int_0^1 \psi(z,t) \, dt$ is a holomorphic function on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_5555
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{D} \to \mathbb{D}$ is holomorphic and $f(0) = 0$, then $\lvert f(z)\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert$ for all $z \in \mathbb{D}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_5558
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{D} \to \mathbb{D}$ is holomorphic and $f(0) = 0$, then $\lvert f'(0)\rvert \leq 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_6052
nl_statement: Suppose $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{C} \setminus \{ 0 \}$ is a piecewise smooth curve and $\theta \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous such that $e^{i\theta(t)} = \gamma(t) / \lvert \gamma(t)\rvert$ for all $t \in [a,b]$, that is, $\theta(t)$ is an argument of $\gamma(t)$. Show that there exists a continuous function $\widetilde{\theta} \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ such that $e^{i\widetilde{\theta}(t)} = \gamma(t) / \lvert \gamma(t)\rvert$ for all $t \in [a,b]$ and $\widetilde{\theta}(a) = \theta(a)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_6142
nl_statement: Suppose $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{C} \setminus \{ 0 \}$ is a piecewise smooth curve and $\theta \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous such that $e^{i\theta(t)} = \gamma(t) / \lvert \gamma(t)\rvert$ for all $t \in [a,b]$. Suppose $\gamma$ is simple and does not go through the origin. Show that there exists a $\widetilde{\theta} \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ such that $e^{i\widetilde{\theta}(t)} = \gamma(t) / \lvert \gamma(t)\rvert$ for all $t \in [a,b]$ and $\widetilde{\theta}(a) = \theta(a)$, and in addition $\widetilde{\theta}(b) = \widetilde{\theta}(a) + 2\pi$ if and only if the origin is inside the region bounded by $\gamma$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_6595
nl_statement: Let $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{C}$ be an injective continuous curve such that $\gamma(a) = \gamma(b)$, and suppose $\gamma$ is piecewise smooth. Show that $\mathbb{C} \setminus \gamma$ has exactly two components.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_9083
nl_statement: If $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and injective, then $f'(z) \not= 0$ for every $z \in U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_9110
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to U$ is piecewise smooth, $g \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, $F \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is continuous, and $F(z) = \int_0^z g(w) \, dw$. Then $\int_\gamma F(z) \, dz = \int_a^b \left( \int_0^{\gamma(t)} g(w) \, dw \right) \gamma'(t) \, dt .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_9551
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open. Then there exists a sequence $K_n$ of compact subsets of $U$ such that $K_n \subset K_{n+1}^\circ$, $U = \bigcup_{n=1}^\infty K_n^\circ$, and for each $n$ there exists a finite collection of closed disks $D_{kn}$ with $K_n \subset \bigcup_k D_{kn} \subset K_{n+1}^\circ$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_10210
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and suppose that $K \subset U$ is compact and has connected complement, and suppose $f \colon U \setminus K \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and $\int_\gamma f(z) \, dz = 0$ for every piecewise smooth closed curve $\gamma$ in $U \setminus K$. Then there exists a holomorphic $F \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ such that $F'(z) = f(z)$ for all $z \in U \setminus K$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_12552
nl_statement: Suppose $f$ is a holomorphic function on a neighborhood of the closed disk $\overline{D}(0,1)$ and suppose $f(0) \not= 0$. Then there exists a constant $C$ such that for all $m \in \mathbb{N}$ and $\lvert z\rvert \leq 1$, $\left\lvert 1 - \sum_{k=0}^m \frac{f^{(k)}(0)}{k! f(0)} \, z^k \right\rvert \leq C \lvert z\rvert^{m+1} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_12576
nl_statement: $\lvert 1-E_m(z)\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert^{m+1}$ for all $m = 0,1,2,\ldots$ and all $z \in \mathbb{D}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_13251
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open, $K \subset U$ compact, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ holomorphic, and $g \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be continuous and holomorphic on $U \setminus K$. Suppose $\int_\gamma g(z) \, dz = 0$ for every piecewise smooth closed $\gamma$ in $U \setminus K$. Then there exists a function $F \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ such that $F$ is holomorphic on $U \setminus K$, $F'(z) = g(z)$ on $U \setminus K$, and $\int_\gamma F(z) \, dz = \int_a^b \left( \int_0^{\gamma(t)} g(w) \, dw \right) \gamma'(t) \, dt$ for every piecewise smooth curve $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_13386
nl_statement: Suppose $K \subset \mathbb{C}$ is compact, $g \colon \mathbb{C} \setminus K \to \mathbb{C}$ is continuous and holomorphic on $\mathbb{C} \setminus K$, and $\int_\gamma g(z) \, dz = 0$ for every piecewise smooth closed curve $\gamma$ in $\mathbb{C} \setminus K$. Then there exists a holomorphic function $F \colon \mathbb{C} \to \mathbb{C}$ such that $F'(z) = g(z)$ on $\mathbb{C} \setminus K$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_13540
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open. Then there exists a sequence $K_n$ of compact subsets of $U$ such that $K_n \subset K_{n+1}^\circ$, $U = \bigcup_{n=1}^\infty K_n^\circ$, and for each $n$ there exists a finite collection of closed disks $D_{kn}$ with $K_n \subset \bigcup_k D_{kn} \subset K_{n+1}^\circ$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_13942
nl_statement: Let $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert zw\rvert = \lvert z\rvert \, \lvert w\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_13974
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Prove that $\lvert z^n\rvert = \lvert z\rvert^n$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14003
nl_statement: Let $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Prove that $\lvert (z+w)^n\rvert \leq 2^{n-1} (\lvert z\rvert^n + \lvert w\rvert^n)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14036
nl_statement: Let $a,b \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert a+b\rvert^2 = \lvert a\rvert^2 + \lvert b\rvert^2 + 2 \Re(a \bar{b})$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14066
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert$ and $\lvert \Im z\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14094
nl_statement: If $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $\lvert z\rvert = 1$, then show that $\bar{z} = 1/z$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14123
nl_statement: If $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $\lvert z\rvert = 1$, then prove that $\Re z \leq \lvert z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14156
nl_statement: Let $a,b \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \Re a - \Re b\rvert \leq \lvert a-b\rvert$ and $\lvert \Im a - \Im b\rvert \leq \lvert a-b\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14187
nl_statement: If $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$, then show that $\lvert z+w\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert + \lvert w\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14216
nl_statement: If $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$, then show that $\lvert z-w\rvert \geq \bigl\lvert \lvert z\rvert - \lvert w\rvert \bigr\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14247
nl_statement: If $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$, then show that $\lvert z-w\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert + \lvert w\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14278
nl_statement: Let $a,z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert \leq \lvert a\rvert/2$. Show that $\lvert a+z\rvert \geq \lvert a\rvert/2$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14310
nl_statement: Let $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Show that $\lvert z^n-w^n\rvert \leq n \max(\lvert z\rvert^{n-1},\lvert w\rvert^{n-1}) \, \lvert z-w\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14347
nl_statement: Let $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$ with $w \not= 0$. Prove that $\left\lvert \frac{z}{w} \right\rvert = \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{\lvert w\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14379
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Prove that $\lvert (1+z)^n - 1\rvert \leq n \lvert z\rvert (1+\lvert z\rvert)^{n-1}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14412
nl_statement: Prove that if $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$ and $\lvert z\rvert = \lvert w\rvert$, then $\lvert z+w\rvert = \lvert z-w\rvert$ if and only if $z \bar{w}$ is purely imaginary.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14450
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert e^z\rvert = e^{\Re z}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14478
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \leq \cosh(\Im z)$ and $\lvert \cos z\rvert \leq \cosh(\Im z)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14511
nl_statement: If $z \in \mathbb{C}$, then prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \cosh(\Re z)$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq \lvert \sinh z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14546
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Show that $\frac{1}{\lvert 1-z\rvert} \leq \frac{1}{1-\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14577
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \geq \lvert \Im z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14607
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cos z - 1\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} \lvert z\rvert^2 e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14638
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tanh z\rvert \leq \tanh \lvert \Re z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14670
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \cosh z - 1\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} \lvert z\rvert^2 e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14701
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \Re z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14730
nl_statement: Prove that if $z \in \mathbb{C}$ and $\lvert z\rvert < 1$, then $\lvert \log(1-z)\rvert \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14763
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Show that $\lvert \arctan z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4} \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14800
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14832
nl_statement: Let $x \in \mathbb{R}$. Show that $\sin x \leq x$ for $x \geq 0$ and $\cos x \geq 1 - \frac{x^2}{2}$ for all $x$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14864
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cos z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14894
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tan z\rvert \geq \lvert \Im z\rvert$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14927
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cos z\rvert \geq \lvert \cos (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14956
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \tan z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2 \lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_14988
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cot z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2 \lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15018
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \csc z\rvert \geq \lvert \csc (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15048
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sec z\rvert \geq \lvert \sec (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15078
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \geq \lvert \sin (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15108
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cos z\rvert \geq \lvert \cos (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15139
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \sinh (\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq \lvert \cosh (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15174
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tanh z\rvert \geq \lvert \tanh (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15205
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \coth z\rvert \geq \lvert \coth (\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15236
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15265
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \lvert \cosh z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15295
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15326
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \Re z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15355
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Show that $\sum_{n=1}^\infty \lvert z\rvert^{n} = \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15383
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cos z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15413
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that for all $n \in \mathbb{N}$, $\left\lvert \sum_{k=0}^n \frac{z^k}{k!} - e^z \right\rvert \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert^{n+1}}{(n+1)!} e^{\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15447
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \tan z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2\lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15479
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert \Re z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4}$. Show that $\lvert \cot z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{2\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15512
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sec z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \csc z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15543
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cos z\rvert \geq \lvert \cos(\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \sin z\rvert \geq \lvert \sin(\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15573
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tanh z\rvert \geq \lvert \tanh(\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \coth z\rvert \geq \lvert \coth(\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15602
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq \lvert \sinh z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15632
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \Re z\rvert$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15663
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Show that $\lvert \log(1-z)\rvert \leq \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{\lvert z\rvert^n}{n} \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15698
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \arctan z\rvert \leq \frac{\pi}{4} \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert}$ whenever $\lvert z\rvert < 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15733
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \leq \frac{1}{2} e^{\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15765
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\sin x \leq x$ for $x \geq 0$ and $\cos x \geq 1 - \frac{x^2}{2}$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_15928
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and injective. Show that $f'(z) \not= 0$ for every $z \in U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_16012
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and $A \subset U$ be compact. Suppose $g \colon U \setminus A \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and that $\int_\gamma g(z) \, dz = 0$ for every piecewise smooth closed curve $\gamma$ in $U \setminus A$. Show that there exists a holomorphic function $F \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ such that $F'(z) = g(z)$ for all $z \in U \setminus A$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_16784
nl_statement: Suppose $\psi \colon \mathbb{D} \to \mathbb{D}$ is holomorphic and $\psi(0)=0$. Prove that $\lvert \psi(z)\rvert \leq \lvert z\rvert$ for all $z \in \mathbb{D}$ and $\lvert \psi'(0)\rvert \leq 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_17244
nl_statement: Let $x =(x_1,x_2,\ldots,x_n) \in \mathbb{R}^n$, $y =(y_1,y_2,\ldots,y_n) \in \mathbb{R}^n$, and $[x,y] = (x_1y_1+x_2y_2+\cdots+x_ny_n)$, then $\lvert [x,y]\rvert^2 \leq [x,x] \, [y,y] .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_17813
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a metric space and $K \subset X$. Suppose $K \subset \bigcup_{j=1}^m B(x_j,r_j),$ where every $B(x_j,r_j)$ is an open ball. Then there is a $\delta > 0$ such that if $0 < r_j < \delta$ for $j=1,2,\ldots,m$, then $\operatorname{vol}(K) \leq \sum_{j=1}^m \operatorname{vol}\bigl( \overline{B}(x_j,r_j) \bigr) .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_17973
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces and suppose $T \colon X \to Y$ is continuous and $K \subset X$ is compact. Show that $T(K)$ is compact.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18048
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces. Show that a set $U \subset X$ is open if and only if for every $x \in U$ there exists an $\epsilon > 0$ such that $B(x,\epsilon) \subset U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18295
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces, $S \subset X$, $p \in X$ and suppose $T \colon X \to Y$ is continuous at $p$. If there exists a sequence $x_n \in S$ such that $x_n \to p$, then $\lim_{n\to\infty} T(x_n) = T(p) .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18862
nl_statement: If $\varphi \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}^n$ is differentiable on $(a,b)$ and continuous on $[a,b]$, then $\operatorname{length}(\varphi) \leq \int_a^b \lVert \varphi'(t) \rVert \, dt .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18895
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\Arg(e^z) = \Im z$ and $\lvert e^z\rvert = e^{\Re z}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18926
nl_statement: Let $\alpha,\beta \in \mathbb{R}$. Prove that $e^{\alpha+\beta} = e^\alpha e^\beta$ and $e^0 = 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18951
nl_statement: If $z \in \mathbb{C}$, then show that $\cos^2 z + \sin^2 z = 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18980
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\cosh^2 z - \sinh^2 z = 1$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19009
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\cos(iz) = \cosh z$ and $\sin(iz) = i \sinh z$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19039
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\cos z = \frac{e^{iz}+e^{-iz}}{2}$ and $\sin z = \frac{e^{iz}-e^{-iz}}{2i}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19072
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\cosh z = \frac{e^{z}+e^{-z}}{2}$ and $\sinh z = \frac{e^{z}-e^{-z}}{2}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19102
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\tanh z = \frac{\sinh z}{\cosh z}$ and $\coth z = \frac{\cosh z}{\sinh z}$ whenever defined.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19134
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\tan z = \frac{\sin z}{\cos z}$ and $\cot z = \frac{\cos z}{\sin z}$ whenever defined.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19164
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\arctan' z = \frac{1}{1+z^2}$ and $\log'(z) = \frac{1}{z}$ where defined.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19195
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Prove that $\log(1-z) = -\sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{z^n}{n}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19226
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $e^{\overline{z}} = \overline{e^z}$ and $\sin(\overline{z}) = \overline{\sin z}$ and $\cos(\overline{z}) = \overline{\cos z}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19257
nl_statement: Let $z,w \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert e^{z} - e^{w}\rvert \leq e^{\max(\Re z, \Re w)} \, \lvert z-w\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19289
nl_statement: Prove that if $z \in \mathbb{C}$, then $\lvert \sin z\rvert \leq \cosh(\Im z)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19320
nl_statement: Prove that if $z \in \mathbb{C}$, then $\lvert \cos z\rvert \leq \cosh(\Im z)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19352
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sin z\rvert \geq \lvert \sin(\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \cos z\rvert \geq \lvert \cos(\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19383
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \cosh(\Re z)$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19414
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Prove that $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq \lvert \sinh z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19445
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \geq \lvert \sinh(\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq \lvert \cosh(\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19476
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \tanh z\rvert \geq \lvert \tanh(\Re z)\rvert$ and $\lvert \coth z\rvert \geq \lvert \coth(\Re z)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19507
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Show that $\lvert \cosh z\rvert \geq 1$ and $\lvert \sinh z\rvert \leq \lvert \cosh z\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19538
nl_statement: Let $z \in \mathbb{C}$ with $\lvert z\rvert < 1$. Prove that $\displaystyle \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{\lvert z\rvert^n}{n} \leq \frac{\lvert z\rvert}{1-\lvert z\rvert}$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19570
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open, $K \subset U$ compact, and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic. Show that $f$ is bounded on $K$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19602
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic. Suppose $f$ is not constant and $f'(z_0)=0$. Show that $z_0$ is a zero of $f'(z)$ of some finite order.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19635
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic. Suppose $f$ is not constant. Show that the set $\{ z \in U : f'(z)=0 \}$ is discrete in $U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19667
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic. If $\lvert f\rvert$ attains a local maximum at $z_0 \in U$, prove that $f$ is constant in a neighborhood of $z_0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19698
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f,g \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ are holomorphic. If $S \subset U$ has an accumulation point in $U$ and $f(z)=g(z)$ for all $z \in S$, show $f \equiv g$ on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19730
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be a domain and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic and nonconstant. If $f(z_0)=c$ and $f'(z_0)=0$, then either $f(z)\equiv c$ or else $z_0$ is a zero of $f-c$ of order $m$ and there exists a neighborhood $V$ of $z_0$ such that $f^{-1}(c) \cap V$ consists of exactly $m$ points (with multiplicity).

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19764
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be a domain and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic. Show that $f$ is analytic on $U$; that is, $f$ has a Taylor series expansion around each point with radius of convergence equal to the distance to the nearest singularity, and the series sums to $f$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19813
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $K \subset U$ is compact, and $f$ is holomorphic on $U$. Show there exists $M>0$ such that $\lvert f(z)\rvert \leq M$ for all $z \in K$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2226
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and let $f = u+iv \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be a function such that $\frac{\partial u}{\partial x}$, $\frac{\partial u}{\partial y}$, $\frac{\partial v}{\partial x}$, and $\frac{\partial v}{\partial y}$ exist and are continuous (that is, $f$ is continuously differentiable). Then $\frac{\partial u}{\partial x} = \frac{\partial v}{\partial y} , \qquad \frac{\partial v}{\partial x} = -\frac{\partial u}{\partial y}$ if and only if $f$ is holomorphic (complex differentiable at all $z \in U$), and $f'(z) = \frac{\partial u}{\partial x} + i \frac{\partial v}{\partial x}$ for all $z \in U$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_2991
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, $p \in U$, and $f'(p) \not= 0$. Suppose further that $f$ is continuously differentiable. Then there exist open sets $V, W \subset \mathbb{C}$ such that $p \in V \subset U$, $f(V) = W$, the restriction $f|_V$ is injective (one-to-one), and hence a $g \colon W \to V$ exists such that $g(y) = (f|_V)^{-1}(y)$ for all $y \in W$. Furthermore, $g$ is holomorphic for $y \in W$, and $g'(y) = \frac{1}{f'(x)} \qquad where x = g(y) .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_4009
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f(U)$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_4834
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $c \in \mathbb{C}$. Then $\{ z \in U : f(z) = c \}$ is a discrete set. Furthermore, if $p \in U$ and $f(p) = c$, then there exists $\delta > 0$ and a holomorphic $g \colon \Delta_\delta(p) \to \mathbb{C}$ such that $g$ is not identically zero, $f(z)-c = {(z-p)}^k g(z) , \qquad for all z \in \Delta_\delta(p) ,$ and $g(p) \not= 0$, where $k \in \mathbb{N}$ is fixed.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_5262
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and suppose $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to U$ is a smooth curve such that $f \circ \gamma$ is a constant. Then $f'(\gamma(t))\gamma'(t) = 0$ for all $t \in [a,b]$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_5312
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $\gamma \colon [a,b] \to U$ is a smooth curve such that $\gamma'(t) \not= 0$ for all $t \in [a,b]$ and $f \circ \gamma$ is constant. Then $f'(\gamma(t)) = 0$ for all $t \in [a,b]$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_5334
nl_statement:
Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U 	o \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $f'(p) 
ot= 0$ for some $p \in U$. Then for sufficiently small $\delta > 0$ and $\epsilon > 0$, for $q \in \Delta_\delta(p)$ with $q 
ot= p$, we have $ rac{f(q)-f(p)}{q-p} 
otin \{ z \in \mathbb{C} : \lvert z vert \leq \epsilon \} .$

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_5367
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $p \in U$, and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $f'(p) \not= 0$. Then there is an open neighborhood $V$ of $p$ such that $f$ restricted to $V$ is injective.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_6177
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Suppose $\alpha \colon [a,b] \to U$ is a smooth curve and $\alpha'(t) \not= 0$ for all $t \in [a,b]$. Then $f \circ \alpha$ changes argument strictly monotonically on $[a,b]$ if and only if $\arg \bigl(f'(\alpha(t)) \alpha'(t)\bigr)$ is constant.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_6258
nl_statement: If $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and connected, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant, and if $p \in U$, then there exists $\delta > 0$ such that the function $f$ restricted to $\Delta_\delta(p) \setminus \{ p \}$ is an open map.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_6276
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $f'(p) \not= 0$ for some $p \in U$. Then there exists an open neighborhood $V$ of $p$ such that $f(V)$ is open and $f|_V$ is injective.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_6543
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic. If $p \in U$ and $f'(p) \not= 0$, then for sufficiently small $\delta > 0$, $f$ restricted to $\Delta_\delta(p)$ is injective.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_6971
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $p \in U$ is such that $f'(p) \not= 0$. Then there exists an open neighborhood $V$ of $p$ such that $f(V)$ is open and $f|_V$ is injective.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_8850
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic and nonconstant. Then for any $w \in f(U)$, there exists $z \in U$ such that $f(z) = w$ and $f'(z) \not= 0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_10441
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic with $f'(p) \not= 0$ for some $p \in U$. Then there exists an open set $V \subset U$ with $p \in V$ such that $f|_V$ is injective and $f(V)$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_12022
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f$ is an open map.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_12199
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and connected, and suppose $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f(U)$ is open, and $f$ is locally injective at all points where $f'(p) \not= 0$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_13802
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and connected and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f$ maps open sets to open sets.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_16997
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant, and $p \in U$ with $f'(p) \not= 0$. Then there exists $\delta > 0$ such that $f \colon \Delta_\delta(p) \to f(\Delta_\delta(p))$ is a bijection, and the inverse is holomorphic.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_17676
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f(U)$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_17853
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant, and $p \in U$ is such that $f'(p) \not= 0$. Then there exist open sets $V, W \subset \mathbb{C}$ such that $p \in V \subset U$, $f(V) = W$, and $f|_V$ is a bijection with holomorphic inverse.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18385
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f$ maps open sets to open sets.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18640
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f$ is an open map.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_18802
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f(U)$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19034
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $f'(p) \not= 0$ for some $p \in U$. Then there exist neighborhoods $V$ of $p$ and $W$ of $f(p)$ such that $f \colon V \to W$ is a bijection and $f^{-1}$ is holomorphic.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19401
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f(U)$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19767
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $f'(p) \not= 0$ for some $p \in U$. Then there exist open sets $V, W \subset \mathbb{C}$ such that $p \in V \subset U$, $f(V) = W$, and $f|_V$ is injective with holomorphic inverse.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19877
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and connected and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f$ is an open map.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_19977
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant, and $p \in U$ is such that $f'(p) \not= 0$. Then there is a neighborhood $V$ of $p$ such that $f \colon V \to f(V)$ is a bijection and $(f|_V)^{-1}$ is holomorphic.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20358
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20635
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and connected and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f(U)$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20896
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $f'(p) \not= 0$ for some $p \in U$. Then there exist open sets $V, W \subset \mathbb{C}$ with $p \in V \subset U$, $f(V) = W$, and $f|_V$ injective with holomorphic inverse.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_20969
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and connected and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_21222
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f(U)$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_21339
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant, and $p \in U$ satisfies $f'(p) \not= 0$. Then there exist open sets $V, W \subset \mathbb{C}$ such that $p \in V \subset U$, $f(V) = W$, and $f|_V$ is injective and has a holomorphic inverse.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_21405
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and connected and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f$ (the complex mapping) is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_21725
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic, and $f'(p) \not= 0$ for some $p \in U$. Then there exist open sets $V, W \subset \mathbb{C}$ with $p \in V \subset U$, $f(V) = W$, and $f|_V$ is injective with a holomorphic inverse.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_21792
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and connected and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f(U)$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_22009
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ be holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f$ is an open mapping.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_22127
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ is open and connected and $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is holomorphic and nonconstant. Then $f \colon U \to \mathbb{C}$ is an open map.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_23077
nl_statement: If $U \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is open and connected, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{R}^m$ is differentiable, and $Df|_x = 0$ for all $x \in U$, then $f$ is constant.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_23404
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a nonempty complete metric space and $f \colon X \to X$ a contraction. Then there exists a unique $p \in X$ such that $f(p) = p$, and for any $x_0 \in X$, the sequence defined by $x_{n+1} = f(x_n)$ converges to $p$.

name: jirilebl_ca_ca_23494
nl_statement: Suppose $U \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is open, $f \colon U \to \mathbb{R}^n$ is continuously differentiable, $p \in U$, and $Df|_p$ is invertible (that is, $\det Df|_p \not=0$). Then there exist open sets $V, W \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ such that $p \in V \subset U$, $f(V) = W$, the restriction $f|_V$ is injective (one-to-one), and hence a $g \colon W \to V$ exists such that $g(y) = (f|_V)^{-1}(y)$ for all $y \in W$. Furthermore, $g$ is continuously differentiable and $Dg|_y = {\bigl(Df|_x\bigr)}^{-1}, \qquad for all x \in V, y = f(x).$
